[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Struct: MempoolNetworkInterface] [Reader starvation] Can continuous write operations on sync_states starve readers, affecting broadcast responsiveness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Function: is_validator()] [Privilege escalation] Can a fullnode exploit logic differences in validator vs fullnode paths to gain unauthorized transaction propagation privileges? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Validator checks] [Bypass via node type] In determine_broadcast_batch, can an attacker manipulate node_type.is_validator() to bypass prioritization and get all sender_buckets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Prioritization] [Validator exemption] Are validators correctly exempted from peer prioritization, or can validator nodes be deprioritized by malicious peers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Retry messages] [Unbounded retries] Can transactions in retry_messages be retried indefinitely without ever succeeding, wasting bandwidth? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Expiration] [Timeout accuracy] Is the ACK timeout calculation accurate across all platforms, or can time drift cause premature/delayed expirations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Retry vs Expired priority] [Selection correctness] Does using max() to choose between expired and retry messages have the correct semantics based on timeline ordering? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Metrics: Counters] [Counter overflow] Can any of the counter::inc() calls overflow internal counters if not properly bounded? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Metrics: RTT] [RTT spoofing] Can malicious peers manipulate RTT measurements by providing fake timestamps to affect peer selection algorithms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Metrics: Latency] [Measurement accuracy] Is broadcast latency measured correctly with Instant::elapsed(), or can async operations skew measurements? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: shared_mempool_batch_size] [Batch size manipulation] Can setting batch_size to u64::MAX cause memory exhaustion when constructing broadcast messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: max_broadcasts_per_peer] [Rate limit bypass] Can an attacker bypass the max_broadcasts_per_peer limit by sending ACKs for non-existent messages to decrement pending count? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: shared_mempool_ack_timeout_ms] [Timeout tuning attack] Can malicious peers analyze timeout patterns to optimize their non-acknowledgment strategy for maximum disruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Field: ready_time] [Time accuracy] Is the ready_time in milliseconds since epoch vulnerable to clock skew between nodes causing incorrect latency calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Field: ready_time] [Privacy leak] Does including ready_time in broadcasts leak information about when transactions entered the mempool, enabling timing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: include_ready_time_in_broadcast] [Protocol version mismatch] Can mismatched configuration between peers cause deserialization failures when one expects ready_time and the other doesn't? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Type: PeerNetworkId] [Identity spoofing] Can an attacker create a PeerNetworkId that collides with a legitimate peer to intercept or corrupt their broadcast state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Type: PeerNetworkId] [Network isolation] Are transactions properly isolated between different network_ids (validator vs VFN vs PFN), or can cross-network pollution occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Enum: BroadcastPeerPriority] [Priority enforcement] Can Primary priority peers fail to receive transactions if Failover logic is incorrectly triggered? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: shared_mempool_failover_delay_ms] [Failover timing] Can the failover delay be too short/long causing premature failover or delayed redundancy? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Failover before filter] [Time calculation] Can the before filter using Instant::now() - Duration cause underflow if failover_delay_ms is misconfigured? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Config: num_sender_buckets] [Bucket count validation] Can num_sender_buckets be set to 0 causing division by zero or empty ranges in bucket iteration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Type: MempoolSenderBucket] [Bucket overflow] Can sender_bucket values exceed num_sender_buckets - 1, causing out-of-bounds access in timeline maps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Logic: Sender bucket assignment] [Distribution fairness] Can the sender bucket assignment algorithm be gamed to concentrate high-value transactions in specific buckets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/shared_mempool/network.rs] [Function: timeline_range_of_message()] [Range validation] Does timeline_range_of_message properly validate that start_end_pairs are within valid bounds before querying? (High)
